alert.note: Alert for Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee, northern Phillips and southwestern Tunica Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 146 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Charles, or 15 miles southwest of Marvell, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marvell, Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, Lexa, Rondo, Watkins Corner, Lake View, Lagrange, Jeffersonville, Haleside, Quarles, Wycamp, Latour, Turkey Scratch, Vineyard, Helena Crossing, Cypress Corner, Poplar Grove, Huma and Big Creek Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
